org.javautil.dataset
Interface Dataset<T>

All Known Subinterfaces:
MutableDataset<T>
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractDataset, ListOfMapsDataset, MatrixDataset, ResultSetDataset
public interface Dataset<T>

A Dataset is conceptually a two dimensional in memory table. This should not be confused with a JDBC ResulSet, however we frequently encapsulate the results of a ResultSet in a Dataset and release the cursor. This disposes of resources and allows the Dataset to be passed around. Think of it as the contents of a spreadsheet where all of the objects in a given column are of the same type. A Dataset may be used to store the results of a Sql Query to be passed around after the query has been closed and the connection returned to the connection pool. The metadata for a Dataset provides for rendering information. @see DatasetMetadata.

Author:
jjs TODO needs positional getRow() TODO needs getById()
